sub_topic: Probability of a certain type of traffic accident occurring on a road
message_1: What is the probability of a rear-end collision occurring on a particular road during rush hour if the historical data shows that there have been 10 rear-end collisions out of 100 accidents during rush hour in the past year?
message_2:
To find the probability of a rear-end collision occurring during rush hour, we can use the historical data provided. There have been 10 rear-end collisions out of 100 accidents during rush hour in the past year.

Probability = (Number of rear-end collisions) / (Total number of accidents)
Probability = 10 / 100

The probability of a rear-end collision occurring during rush hour is 10/100, which can be simplified to 1/10 or 0.1. So, there is a 10% chance of a rear-end collision occurring during rush hour on that particular road.
